description: Free CSV exports with play-by-play, shots, expected goals, on-ice skaters, score state, and goalie stats for every NHL game since 2007.
how_to_use_in_project: Primary NHL event- and game-level training data for xG/xA models, goalie evaluation, shot quality features, and BLB-vs-NHL player style comps.

description: Subscription site with RAPM, WAR/GAR, contract projections, and rich team/player dashboards built from NHL play-by-play.
how_to_use_in_project: Benchmark for advanced-impact metrics; use their public methodology docs as inspiration for RAPM-style models on BLB plus NHL data.

description: Free website with Corsi, Fenwick, scoring-chance, and high-danger stats, plus a glossary describing all definitions.
how_to_use_in_project: Mirror their event filters and score/zone/strength buckets to keep BLB shot metrics comparable to NHL conventions.

description: Hand-tracked zone entries, exits, and passing microstats; blog + Tableau dashboards with player style visualizations.
how_to_use_in_project: Model for your BLB microstat schema and dashboards; emulate entry/exit/pass classifications and player style comp visualizations.

description: Subscription site with beautiful heatmaps, player isolated impact charts, and xG-based team summaries.
how_to_use_in_project: Inspire rink/net visual layouts; mimic isolated impact ideas (separating player from teammates) in future BLB models.

description: Official NHL tracking stats like skating speed, shot speed, and zone time broken out by player and team.
how_to_use_in_project: Target for long-term CV/ML roadmap: replicate a subset of EDGE-style outputs (speed, distance, rush vs cycle) from your video tracking.

description: Comprehensive traditional boxscore, season, and franchise stats for NHL players and teams.
how_to_use_in_project: Back-fill season-level context, league averages, and baselines to normalize BLB players vs NHL distributions.

description: Open-source R package that scrapes and stores NHL play-by-play data, plus an XGBoost expected-goals model example.
how_to_use_in_project: Reference implementation for scraping NHL data and building xG models; adapt concepts to Python / your Postgres schema.

description: Community documentation for NHL's undocumented stats API endpoints (games, teams, shifts, play-by-play).
how_to_use_in_project: Programmatic ingestion of NHL schedule, rosters, and play-by-play directly into a raw/stage layer.

description: Legacy blog posts explaining Corsi, Fenwick, score effects, and early public xG work (some content now mirrored elsewhere).
how_to_use_in_project: Conceptual grounding for shot-based metrics and score/zone/strength adjustments used in modern models.

description: Plain-language explanation of expected goals, inputs, and limitations in hockey analytics.
how_to_use_in_project: Onboarding material for teammates and coaches; use as a teaching reference alongside your own xG documentation.

description: Community-hosted snapshots of NHL play-by-play and shift data ready for rapid ML prototyping.
how_to_use_in_project: Sandbox for trying ML ideas quickly before wiring them into your main Postgres + BLB pipeline.
